article.headline: N.C.-Asheville 83, W. Carolina 73
article.story: CULLOWHEE, N.C. (AP) -- Three North Carolina-Asheville players scored at least 20 points each, and the Bulldogs beat Western Carolina 83-73 on Tuesday night to improve to 5-0 for the first time in school history. Vincent James scored 22 points on 8-of-11 shooting, and Reid Augst and K.J. Garland each scored 20 for UNC Asheville, which shot 55.3 percent. The Bulldogs also snapped a two-game losing streak in the series by taking control early. After spotting the Catamounts an early 2-0 lead, UNC Asheville responded by scoring 14 straight points during a 21-5 run that ended when Garland's 3-pointer with 13:21 until the break made it 21-7. Jake Robinson led Western Carolina (2-3) with 19 points off the bench. Nick Aldridge scored 13 and Michael Porrini added 12. The Catamounts made 15 of the 34 3-pointers they attempted, outrebounded the Bulldogs 39-37 and committed just nine turnovers. The Bulldogs entered having opened the season with four victories for the first time since 1981.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
